title: What is HTML5 Semantic Elements?
description: HTML5 semantic elements are elements that clearly describe their meaning to both the browser and the developer. These elements include: <article>, <aside>, <details>, <figcaption>, <figure>, <footer>, <header>, <main>, <mark>, <nav>, <section>, <summary>, and <time>.

title: New form elements in Html 5
description: datalist, output, keygen, progress, and meter

title: non-semantic elements
description: non-semantic elements: <div> and <span> - Tells nothing about its content.

title: Inline Elements
description: An inline element only takes up as much width as necessary.
